content.description: Crack in the back of an overhanging symmetrical dihedral.  Looks like a wizard's hat.
content.location: First route on wizard wall.  40 feet before reaching Settled Controversy.  Big dihedral resembling its namesake.

content.description: Bouldery start leads to 5.10ish climbing above
content.location: Third and final (leftmost) route in the Leprosy Cave (see Brown Recluse for directions to the cave)

content.description: The route that starts above a bolder near a fallen tree
content.location: 20ish feet to the left of Settled Controversy

content.description: Start climbing below and to the right of the crack in the middle of the wall.
content.protection: 2 draws, mid size cams and mid size nuts + anchor
content.location: About 75 feet left of Settled Controversy.

content.description: Climb the dark red face using everything you can find
content.location: This route lies between a big leaning boulder and the dihedral of Eat Dirt

content.description: A super fun sport route up the flaring gully.  Crux comes at 2/3 height and it really makes you stand and deliver!
content.location: Middle route in Leprosy Cave (see Brown Recluse for directions to the cave) apx 10 feet southeast/down the cliff from Brown Recluse

content.description: Initially lead on 3 bolts, rated 5.11c. 2 bolts added + anchor shared with Deception.
content.location: Between Deception (overhang crack/dihedral) and Suspended Animation

content.description: Thought provoking start. Move up and a little right on the Face.
content.location: two sport routes left of Mud Pie. Last sport route before the leaning block.

content.description: Ascend the lieback flake with the horn on top.  Top out on right.
content.protection: Small nuts, mid-sized cam, 2 draws + anchor
content.location: Directly behind a VW bug sized rock.

climbs.name: Retrospect
climbs.fa: Equipped by Phillip Carrier FA Jared Smith 2018

content.description: This project is the face climb between the two cracks
content.location: First sport route to the right of Settled Controversy

content.description: Good slabby/vertical sport route worth doing as you work down to the Gallery.  This route is also immediately to the right of the wide crack that is the route Eat Dirt.
content.location: Down the wall from the hand line by the main fall/pool on the way to the Gallery by maybe 80 yards.

content.description: Be patient with this one, it will be slow going on not so confidence inspiring holds. Slowly pull your way up a water groove
content.location: First sport route to the right of Suspended Animation

content.description: This widish crack flares somewhat and is usually fairly dirty and rarely done.  It's really not as bad as that description sounds though!
content.protection: Medium to large sized gear - you can use the anchor of Mud Pie right next door to rap and clean.
content.location: This route is on the way to the Gallery down from the main pool/hand line by maybe 80 yards.

climbs.name: Deception
climbs.fa: FA- Eric Ulner 1985 Around 1992, Jim Thurmond bouldered down it after bouldering Wizard's Hat for a warm-up.

content.description: Climb the dihedral crack next to the low roof.
content.protection:
Small and mid-sized cams and nuts 

  Share anchor with Spring Animation

content.description: Another Frizzell technical masterpiece.  Finishes in between two high water grooves
content.location: From the main pool/hand line walking southwest down the cliff line you will see the Leprosy cave (deep but only apx 4 ft high at it's tallest) will be up and right after about 100 yards.  Brown Recluse is the first sport route you will see.

content.description: The route between Wizards Hat and Eat Dirt. This one will need some cleaning before a send attempt
content.location: Left of the leaning boulder near Wizards Hat

content.description: Long wall between The Gallery and North Falls Area. South - east face.  Few 5.9 trad and sport routes.
